A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
The Star Wars writers have a plethora of stories they could have used from all of the books written over the past 20+ years.  Instead they give us this goofy story full of plot holes and dead ends.  
Where is the New Republic Fleet?
Why is there only 1 capital ship in the resistance fleet?
Why is the resistance leadership all women?  
What is this - Mother's Against the First Order?
Why the heck\, after 30+ years of fighting snub fighters\, hasn't the First Order come up with an anti-snub fighter turret to ward off  X-Wings and A-Wings? 
Where are the rest of the Knights of Ren? 
Did they all die?  Are they just chilling somewhere?
What is Supreme Leader Snoke's history?
How old is he?  Where was he during the fall of the Empire?  Who was his Master?  How is he so strong in the Force?
Luke Skywalker - he finally starts talking and he refers to his lightsaber as a "laser sword"??  Who wrote this crap?!
And the creepy scene where he drinks milk from those goofy looking sea-cows??  Did we really need that?
Finn and Rose's little sidequest to the casino?  We didn't need that.  It was filler.
So many holes.  So many dead ends - the big reveal about Rey's parents??  Totally anti-climactic.  Another mystery ruined.

This movie just felt totally disconnected and lost to me.
I sat there shaking my head a lot wondering who wrote the dialogue for this flick.
I left the theater a little bewildered and I wondered where the mystery and suspense of Star Wars had gone.
I sure didn't feel the Force when I finished watching this movie.
